page.title: 02MEMORIES OF COTTINGLEY
page.content: {Mrs.Watkins has lived at Cottingley for thirty years,twenty years in a prefab.In 1947 Cottingley Hall Farm was purchased by the Council who put up 630 prefabs,imported from Norway, each having a lounge,2 bedrooms, kitchen and toilet.After the war oil lamps were used and cookers and frid- ges were gas powered.The residents took pride in their lovely big gardens receiving letters from the Council if they were neglected.Permission from the Housing Department was required to own a dog.In the middle of the estate was a chapel and a neat little row of shops. {Mrs.Watkins commented on the lack of vandalism during these years,and what a happy close knit community it was. She sometimes whishes she was living in her little prefab today,when Cott- ingley estate was well looked after.
